description.narrative:
Den föreslagna insatsen omfattar ett fyraårigt program för att stärka Kosovos statistiksystem. Insatsen är fokuserad på att stärka Kosovos Statistikbyrå (KAS) och dess roll i det nationella statistiksystemet.
Den totala budgeten för den föreslagna insatsen är 3 530 000 EUR. Av dessa finansierar EU, genom EU-kontoret i Pristina, 2 000 000 EUR vilka kommer att utbetalas till Sida i enlighet med det delegeringsavtal som partnerna ingick i december 2018. Sidas bidrag till insatsen är 1 530 000 EUR från den bilaterala budgeten för reformsamarbete med Kosovo. Detta beslut omfattar därmed 16 millioner SEK, vilket skall motsvara 1 530 000 EUR
Delegeringsavtalet mellan EU och Sida , och dess bilagor, beskriver det övergripande syftet med samarbetet. Sida ansvarar för implementeringen och rapporteringen av insatsen gentemot EU (representerat av EU-kontoret i Pristina). Sida avser att ingå överenskommelse med Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) för att genomföra resultatkomponenter 1, nationalräkenskaper, och 2, social statistik, baserat på deras unika sakexpertis. Detta tillvaratar de goda relationer och den kontextspecifika kunskap som SCB har byggt upp i sitt långvariga samarbete med Kosovo och är samtidigt i linje med Sidas prioriteringar vad gäller myndighetssamverkan. SCB har dock inte möjlighet att bidra med sakexpertis och/eller resurser för projektets tre övriga resultatkomponenter vilka omfattar IT-system, koordinering inom statistiksystemet samt ledarskaps- och organisationsutveckling. Sidas implementerande partner för dessa resultatkomponenter kommer därför - då ingen möjlig partner med kompetens och möjlighet att genomföra dessa delar har identifierats - att handlas upp i enlighet med LOU. Sida kommer därtill att ingå avtal med KAS - vilket är centralt för att säkerställa KAS engagemang och ägarskap i projektet.
Centrala dialogfrågor under implementering utgörs av: * Vikten av att framhålla och stärka KAS nationella ägarskap och aktiva roll i projektet. * Säkerställandet av tillgängliga resurser för KAS i relation till implementeringen (detta gäller specifikt IT-resurser). * Uppföljning av KAS utveckling på områdena ledarskap och organisationsutveckling. * Behovet av att stärka integrering av Sidas tematiska perspektiv, med fokus på konflikt-, rättighets - och fattigdomsperspektivet.

This intervention is a four year comprehensive programme with the aim to strengthen the National Statistics System of Kosovo (NSS), with the Kosovo Agency of Statistics (KAS) at the core: Strengthening of the Statistical System of Kosovo, 2019-2022. This programme will be supported by the EU, represented by the EU Office in Kosovo and the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida), represented by the Swedish Embassy in Pristina. The EU contribution of 2 million euro will be delegated to Sida. Sida will contribute an additional 16 million SEK to the project. Sida, through the Embassy of Sweden in Kosovo, will oversee the contribution in full.
Sida's national partner will be KAS. Sida will furthermore enter into a service purchase agreement with Statistics Sweden (SCB) to implement component 1 and 2 of the programme, in national and social statistics. Sida will furthermore though open procurement in accordance with LOU procure a second implementing partner to implement components in IT, coordination and organizational development (3,4,5)

The overall objective of the contribution is to contribute to the strengthening of the statistical system of Kosovo by enabling the development of reliable statistical information and facilitating improved decision making. Specifically, this action aims at increasing the capacities of KAS to carry out its core activities in a standardised and independent manner – in line with EU standards – as well as strengthen KAS’s management and coordination capacities. To attain this overarching objective, the contribution aims to: * Improve the timeliness and shortening the timing of the release of all statistics in order to improve the Kosovo Government’s decision-making process; * Improve inter-institutional coordination and information sharing among the main stakeholders in the statistical sector; * Improve data dissemination by enhancing data availability and visibility for public users; * Support KAS in carrying out its core activities and mandate in a standardised and independent manner. The above objectives are foreseen to be achieved trough the achievement of the following five results: 1: Further improvement of sector statistics and National Accounts statistics 2: Further improvement of sector statistics and National Accounts statistics 3: Further improvement of metadata systems, documentation and dissemination and modernisation of data collection methods 4: Strengthening of planning and coordination of the statistical system to improve the delivery of objectives and outputs in line with the 5-year programme for official statistics, and the communication and collaboration with key stakeholders 5. Building the overall capacity and resilience of KAS to maximize results and achieve sustainability by means of a series of linked The results above correspond to the five components of the programme and are all, in the logical framework of the programme, measurable through verifiable indicators. The programme document further clarifies the programme structure and proposed sets of activities under each results/components. Though at a fairly detailed level already, these will be further elaborated on in the three month inception phase of the programme where a more detailed time-line for the programme will also be agreed upon.

description.narrative:
During this second year of implementation of the programme the political climate in Kosovo has been unstable, which has led to instability in the work of the government. Consequently, this has impacted the efficiency and effectiveness of work in all institutions. Apart from this, COVID19 has affected the work at the institutions. The implementation of the programme is on track and the vast majority of planned activities are being implemented. Some interventions are experiencing delays in implementation and have a slightly lower utilization rate of funds. Although progress has been made in improving statistical system, further improvements are needed. Highlights from the report: R1 There has been some improvements when it comes to national accounts and business statistics. Emphasis on: Transition of table 0303 to Eurostat, and NOE calculations on restaurants KAS is self-sustainable, which demonstrates that the institutional capacities has been raised at KAS. Apart from this, questionnaires were prepared for STS and SBS, which will improve the quality of statistics.
R2 Some progress has been made. Nevertheless, in the upcoming two years the project will focus more on this result area. When it comes to triangulation of data discussions have been initiated between KAS and Civil Registry Agency (CRA) to share data between the two government institutions, however further work is needed in the coming years. KAS has, for the first time, published SILC and Eurostat has published in their website. Given that statistics is defined as information about the economic and social conditions in a society, it can provide many of the facts needed when socio-political reforms are discussed, planned and implemented. SILC will contribute to the knowledge needed for reforms in this area of social-economic. Gender Equality Index has improvement and Kosovo has more data on this area now. LCS questionnaire is prepared, further work will be done on this.
R3 Metadata process is extensive, therefore until the end of the project support will be provided. The activities are going in the right direction. Staff has attended several trainings online (Udemy), which has contributed to the cultural learning change in the institution. IT equipment has contributed to digitalization of KAS. Staff Satisfaction Survey has improved, and staff was trained. The team at KAS is self-sustainable for the next one, minor help for project will be provided. Whereas, IT capacities are still low, further support will be needed in capacity building and also resources (new employees). A cyber security assessment was conducted which detected several risks. These will be assessed together with KAS in the upcoming period.
R4 Progress was made towards this result. Innovative electronic training courses (on questionnaire design and testing), methodology descriptive on interviewing techniques were held. The highlight of this was that junior staff found these trainings more appealing than senior ones did. Gender Statistics webinar was held, this includes provision of gender-disaggregated statistics, as well as the production of gender specific outputs and studies wherever possible. It is crucial that all KAS personnel have in their mind set of work the gender-sensitivity.
R5 Progress was made towards this result. Out of 8 inters 6 were recruited. Sida will push to hire the IT inters in upcoming reporting period. Sida pushed the recruitment to be gender balanced. Documents were produced for internal use. However, a close monitoring will be needed on how these documents will be implemented in KAS.
Communication: During the year, folders, notebooks and stickers with the EU and Swedish logo were shared with all partners for them to use in line with the communication Plan. Partners also displayed the EU and Swedish logo in several events and printed products during the year. However, the communication plan is lacking behind. Therefore, focus in upcoming two years should be put in implementing the communication plan that was presented.
Donors: Since the start of the EU-Sida support in the area of economic statistics, IPAMB2017 has also begun support to KAS in the area of NA. Initially there was concern that these two projects would compete for the same (scarce) staff resources and have similar activities, which will lead to duplication. However, this has been avoided as both Statistics Sweden and IPAMB2017 team through working together and ensure complementary activities. Consequently, a joint work plan has been agreed upon and followed.
Risk management is an integral and continuous part of Sidas routines when working with project management. The foreseen risks for the programme are listed below at risk register.
As the programme is moving into its third and last year of implementation Sida plans to provide assistance to partners as they elaborate their programme proposals for the coming phase regarding integration of gender equality, anti-corruption and capacity development. Follow-up the implementation speed in 2021 to monitor the delayed activities.
PIU: During the reporting period some changes where done within implementation of project. SCB had internal reorganization. Therefore, LTE for Kosovo was changed. The new TL will join the project fully from the August 2021 (next reporting period). The position of administrative assistance was redundant. However, after close monitoring it was decided this position to be reinforced. Next reporting period new administrative assistant will be employed.
Financial: during the reported period 563,563 EURO were spend. This is amount is slightly lower than predicted, which was expected keeping into consideration COVID 19. SCB's total expenditure for this period was 3,015,789 SEK, whereas the total amount forecasted was 3,524,002 SEK. Which means 85.5% of the planned budget was utilized. Whereas, FCG's total expenditure was 2,503,745 SEK, while the forecasted budget was 3,545,054 SEK. Which means 70% of the budget was utlized.
During the reported period also the Embassy has done the reallocation of the budget (from general implementation budget line to FCG contract) where an amount of 114,700 SEK for audit was added to the contract to FCG, in order to execute the payment to
FCG. PO requested from FCG to send a more detailed budget and forecast for the upcoming years where audit is included as well. In the budget of 15,309,000 SEK was added 114,700 SEK for the audit payment.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
